docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. l--Secretary General Thant will give his formal agreement tomorrow to a Security Council recommendation that he serve another term in office, with enlarged opportunities for effective action on world issues such as the war...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. l--Secretary General Thant will give his formal agreement tomorrow to a Security Council recommendation that he serve another term in office, with enlarged opportunities for effective action on world issues such as the war in Vietnam.

headline.main: ELECTION OF THANT WITH WIDER ROLE IN U.N. DUE TODAY; Acceptance of Council Plan to Let Him Act for Peace in New Term Reported

byline.original: By DREW MIDDLETON Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 2--Secretary General Thant was unanimously re-elected to another term of office by the General Assembly tonight and pledged his personal efforts to end the war in Vietnam.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 2--Secretary General Thant was unanimously re-elected to another term of office by the General Assembly tonight and pledged his personal efforts to end the war in Vietnam.
docs.abstract: Thant notes accords on holiday cease-fires, s, UN Assembly; hopes they may lead to peace talks

headline.main: THANT, RENAMED, VOWS NEW EFFORT TO END ASIAN WAR; U.N. Assembly Is Unanimous in Giving Him Another Term as Secretary General ACTIVE ROLE INDICATED He Has Understanding With Council on Bringing Crisis Situations Before It

byline.original: By DREW MIDLETON Special to The New York Times

headline.main: SHIPPING-MAILS; ALL HOURS GIVEN IN EASTERN STANDARD TIME

docs.snippet: About 200 educators and scientists in five cities have joined a new Cultural Committee to Aid Argentine Intellectuals. Hundreds of university members have been reported displaced by policies of the regime of President Juan Carlos Ongania.
docs.lead_paragraph: About 200 educators and scientists in five cities have joined a new Cultural Committee to Aid Argentine Intellectuals. Hundreds of university members have been reported displaced by policies of the regime of President Juan Carlos Ongania.
docs.abstract: Some 200 Amers form com to aid Argentine univ members displaced or forced into exile

headline.main: EDUCATORS IN U.S. TO AID ARGENTINES; Seek Positions for Hundreds Displaced in Universities

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec, 5--Britain called tonight for an early meeting of the Security Council to propose "additional measures to be taken against the illegal regime in Rhodesia."
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec, 5--Britain called tonight for an early meeting of the Security Council to propose "additional measures to be taken against the illegal regime in Rhodesia."

docs.snippet: THE South American Championships played in Sao  Paulo, Brazil, last month, resulted in the closest finish ever recorded in an international event. Venezuela and Brazil tied for first position on victory point scores, and played an additional 30-board...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE South American Championships played in Sao Paulo, Brazil, last month, resulted in the closest finish ever recorded in an international event. Venezuela and Brazil tied for first position on victory point scores, and played an additional 30-board match to decide the title.
docs.abstract: S Amer Champ in Sao Paulo, Brazil, in Nov revd

headline.main: Bridge:; Venezuela Defeats Brazil In Playoff by One I.M.P.

docs.snippet: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 7 Rhodesia asked the United Nations Security Council today for a chance to be heard in any debate on the imposition of mandatory economic sanctions against it.

docs.abstract: Rhodesia asks to be heard in UN debate on sanctions; Brown explains Brit views on sanctions to Commonwealth delegates; counters demands for immediate, inclusive sanctions

headline.main: Rhodesia Asks for Role in U.N. Sanctions Debate; Rejection of Request Likely  Meeting Opens Today Says It Is Entitled to Speak in Security Council

byline.original: By LAWRENCE FELLOWS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 8 (UPI)--The 10-member Latin American Free Trade Association voted unanimously today to convert the trade group into a political bloc.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 8 (UPI)--The 10-member Latin American Free Trade Association voted unanimously today to convert the trade group into a political bloc.
docs.abstract: Votes to become pol bloc, meeting, Montevideo; Bolivia to be 11th member

headline.main: Latin Trade Group Votes To Become Political Bloc

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 9 (AP) The United States champion, Earl Elms of San Diego, regained the lead today by finishing second in the fifth race of the Western Hemisphere Snipe Class yachting championships.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 9 (AP) The United States champion, Earl Elms of San Diego, regained the lead today by finishing second in the fifth race of the Western Hemisphere Snipe Class yachting championships.

headline.main: ELMS, U.S., REGAINS SNIPE CLASS LEAD
